website_summaries.verdict: This compact spray bottle makes for a great training tool.
pros: Not only is this pleasantly scented spray effective, but it also makes a hissing sound when dispensed that frightens cats
Customers find this spray to be a great teaching tool that works particularly well on kittens
cons: You cats may become afraid of you rather than the spray

customer_reviews.title: My cat fears this orange can of discipline. Update ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat fears this orange can of discipline. Update: he's begun hiding the can Update: he's weaponized the can... my wife... Update: bought another can and now the situation is under control again.
customer_reviews.author: Dodie50

customer_reviews.title: Not good for sensitive cats
customer_reviews.text: If you have a cat with anxiety, don't get this product. Mystery is our high strung cat with anxiety issues. I read that you shouldn't spray cats with water in a spray bottle and that this was a better option. When Mystery went over to paw at the TV I decided it was a good time to try this. Not only did she freak out from the loud hissing noise, she hid for at least ten minutes under the couch. I felt horrible for doing it. It didn't help that our other cat, Mayhem, was also scared of it. Happy to hear it works for some, but it was definitely not something for our girls.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie R.

customer_reviews.title: The Noise Works / Compressed Air
customer_reviews.text: I use these for my cats when they cry and scratch at my fiancé’s office door while he works. The scent doesn’t seem to do anything, they’ll return to the spot shortly after I spray it. However the noise works well, they aremore afraid of the noise than anything. It’s gotten to where I can just show them the can and they know they’ve done something wrong. This stuff can get pricey though so I just started keeping a can of compressed air (keyboard cleaner) around the house and use it instead. I never spray ether of those items on the cats. This is how they look at me if I go for the can while they’re scratching up furniture.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Safe Your Money
customer_reviews.text: This product smells so bad it will repel you---your cat, not so much. My cat ignored this. It was so strong with a fake floral smell I had to open windows to air out the room. Also, the container got so frigid cold when I sprayed ONCE that it almost gave me frost bite. Seriously. I threw it in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: WuZetian

customer_reviews.title: NOT WHAT YOU EXPECTED
customer_reviews.text: This is a very high-pitched airhorn that squirts perfume. If your cats don't care for cheap perfume, then it might work for you. I paid for this. Most reviewers don't Note: I've been threatened with banishment by Amazon for speaking honestly
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but compressed CO2 gas that empties in less than ONE second!
customer_reviews.text: This product is pure FRAUDULENT consumer deception! I was going to use it for keeping pets away from my computer work space and followed the directions entirely. But in less than 1 second of pressing the spray button, the entire contents of the can emptied completely! And it was absolutely Nothing But Ultra Compressed CO2 gas which made the can suddenly turn as cold as DRY ICE and gave my hand SEVERE FROSTBITE burns. I also lost several layers of skin due to the can sticking like super glue to the burnt skin. I am considering filing a lawsuit against the manufacturer for Emergency Room expenses! BUYERS BEWARE... I did not shake the can before use either... I knew better.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Ridenour

customer_reviews.title: just loud noise, not much else
customer_reviews.text: well, i can say one thing for sure - it's loud. ...eventually my cat got used to the sound and just ignored it, though not much scares him anyways. ..and there's not a whole lot of the liquid in the canister - seemed to empty out really quickly. In the end I felt it just wasn't worth the money. Though i might want to use it to wake up my kids in the morning (hehe!).
customer_reviews.author: Search Party

customer_reviews.title: Great behavorial therapy for bad behavior
customer_reviews.text: I love this item. When my cat over-meows, all I do is get the can out and hit the nozzle with a small burst and she takes off. I have cand in rooms all over my house. Sometimes even just getting the can out and pointing it her way is enough for her to leave the scene.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne R. Rice

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This works great! Has a very loud "pst" sound that will literally have them in the air! Make sure there's no glass around when they're on the counter cause stuff could get broken. No matter how many times you do it, it still scares them.. I have seen a big improvement in their behavior. Not perfect, but they listen better now. Just seeing the bright orange can is enough for them to know they're in trouble! Just a note, you may need a few cans at first to have in different locations. You want to be able to have it in hand when they misbehave.
customer_reviews.author: Judy T.

customer_reviews.title: At four bucks, it's definitely worth the try. A++ results
customer_reviews.text: Holy behaving cat, Batman. So my cat is female, unspayed, about a year old. I just got a big flat screen TV about a month ago and for weeks she would not leave it alone. I'd repremand her, try giving her other toys (she has lots), physically move her from the TV, everything. Now I can't promise the same results for you. Every cat is different. But she responded to this from the first spray. I've had it for two weeks, and I've used it twice. She won't go near my TV. And at four bucks, I could not be more pleased. It also hasn't changed her behavior otherwise - she's still the same energetic, independent, cuddly-when-sleepy cat.
customer_reviews.author: Roofus

customer_reviews.title: Really Works!
customer_reviews.text: Our kitten was getting up on the table and counters, as well as scratching the furniture. After a few days of using this consistently he usually doesn’t go where he’s not supposed to! On the occasions he does, all I need to do is grab the can, he gets down. It stops him from scratching, but he still does it routinely. We’re getting a scratching post. The smell isn’t overpowering or bad, but our kitten won’t go back to the area where it was sprayed for quite awhile.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kuhn

customer_reviews.title: Really works!
customer_reviews.text: I seriously love this stuff! We have two cats who've hellbent on destroying the upholstery on my new sectional. I've been keeping the targeted areas covered with blankets at night, but when I'm around during the day and one of them tries to strike I spray one dose of the deterrent and they make a beeline down stairs. I've had to use this 4 or 5 times the first week, but the cats have mostly left my sofa alone! I'm so happy! They'll still lounge around with me on the sofa, but no scratching. FYI: the smell kind of smells like granny potpourri (I'm pregnant and sensitive to smells), but the benefit outweighs the ick factor of the smell.
customer_reviews.author: sarah_thatgirl

customer_reviews.title: Ewww the smell for no real results
customer_reviews.text: Very loud hissing noise scares cats from unwanted behaviors, but the fake pheromone scent is so awful that I'm left to suffer with it since they've run and are long gone. It's a rather overwhelming scent & seemingly pointless since the purpose of the noise is to scare them away, so how are they smelling pheromones? My cats still engage in the behaviors I'd spray them for, but now they're just much more cautious & ready to bolt. I hold the empty can as a threat & then they stare nonstop until I put it down. Smells terrible & doesn't train cats, just stops bad behavior in the moment & costs too much for that.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke C

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my kittens from destroying my house :)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to try to get my kittens to stop scratching our couch, and I'm surprised at how effective it is. I've tried cat repellents and such in the past but never a spray can like this. I want to buy these things to keep all over our house to help train our kitties to stay off counters, stay away from the door, etc. They run when I spray it, but they don't seem to be in distress at all, which is nice. They just don't like the noise. So far, it is keeping the kitties from engaging in the unwanted behaviors as often, and I'm really impressed!
customer_reviews.author: A. Bosky

customer_reviews.title: If you want your cat to be deathly afraid of you... Use this product..
customer_reviews.text: If you want your cat to be deathly afraid of you, and run out of the room every time you walk in, then use this. You have to get very close, so the cat knows you're the one punishing it, bad idea.
customer_reviews.author: EGem

customer_reviews.title: Love, love
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this product. I have placed two, very strategically in my formal guest room and the cats will not go into that room even if their favorite toy happens to end up in that room. Best part, it has scared the crap out of my husband as well.....priceless.
customer_reviews.author: Honey joon

customer_reviews.title: A miracle!
customer_reviews.text: My kitten is constantly climbing on things she shouldn’t be. Like my tv stand, and trying to claw my TV. Or onto my vanity and getting into my makeup. One small puff of this and she’s done with that behavior. I’ve trying the scent sprays that are supposed to deter cats from certain areas but they don’t do a thing for her. This definitely works!!
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Works Ok, Should Pair It With Collars & Diffusers
customer_reviews.text: We bought this along with the pheromone collars and diffusers. They all work together great but overall I don't really like this product as much on its own. It makes a loud hissing sound that is supposed to help correct behavior, and it does, but other than that I don't see a huge difference from this product alone. The collars and diffusers seem to do most of the work when it comes to them not scratching and peeing. I guess I would say if you have tried the other products and want to try this go ahead but overall this is just an additional step and I wouldn't recommend it as an overall solution to the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver
customer_reviews.text: This product saved me from becoming an alcoholic cat father that gets no sleep because his cat reins terror in the middle of the night like a demon. Cat up in the table? Cat scratching all your prized possessions? Cat in the way while begging for the only thing he thinks you exist for in the kitchen? Well not anymore! Seriously it works, corrected bad behavior in two tries. Now I don't have to go to AA mettings because of a cat that doesn't respect me. My cats name is Tito in case you were wondering, yes after Titos vodka. Titos a good kittah now, haven't even gone through half the bottle.
customer_reviews.author: J. Neal

customer_reviews.title: I love it and my cats hate it! (which is good)
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this to train my cats. It scares the crap out of them so it does the job. I enjoy the smell, but wish the cans were bigger. Will continue to buy when they are on sale, the price fluctuates from over $11 to $4 or less so I keep my eye on it for when there are deals on here.
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Used their calming spray with great results. My little guy went thru a jealous ...
customer_reviews.text: Used their calming spray with great results. My little guy went thru a jealous period deciding to using me as a chew you was the best way to let me know I used Stop That with good results. I didn't have a backup so he started to see how far he could go so I had to buy anouther can he sees it I spray but sometime just the can makes him behave. It's nice not to have to give him a spray that is nasty to taste and smell. So much better for him and me.
customer_reviews.author: IrishPooh

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately just a short solution
customer_reviews.text: I had too high of hopes for this little orange can. The noise wasn't too incredibly loud, but just enough to startle my kitten into stopping whatever he was doing for a short amount of time before going back to it. It never changed his behaviors for long so it didn't do what I had hoped. The smell was similar to cheap floral perfume and the kitten didn't seem to care much about it. I used to use a spray bottle before this and will unfortunately be going back since they have the same effect but water is cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Paty

customer_reviews.title: Really Works!
customer_reviews.text: I have always had cats in my house. This year I added 3 abandoned kittens to my family of 2. When I got a new sofa and chair I was worried about my 5 furballs using them as scratch posts! I used this spray once or twice and they RUN! The Christmas tree was an immediate attraction. One spray and they never went back! Now I just say NO and hiss, and they stop whatever they are doing and run. They don't like that hiss noise. Friends are also amazed at how easily and harmlessly this thing works!
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Quite useful! Works!
customer_reviews.text: This just cracks me up cause my cat knows even the sound of the lid coming off now and will run! I believe it has worked and I’m thankful for it. I’m usually skeptical anymore with things to try to use to prevent your cat from doing things, but this one seems to work. Need another one for upstairs for when he wakes me up early to eat. It just cracks me up and makes me laugh cause he responds so well to it. The smell is not so amazing for myself to smell but it doesn’t linger too long. It’s really loud, but effective because of it being loud.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Norman

customer_reviews.title: This works! Cat sees it, runs, calms down.
customer_reviews.text: This works to keep naughty cats from getting into trouble. I have one car that is jealous of everything. She will pick a fight just because one cat is getting attention or has a you or is just sitting where she wants to be. I sprayed it once and she took off. The next time I sprayed it she stopped being a jerk and left the room. Third time when I brought it out without spraying she took off. There is a nice, calming scent that lingers for Lexi than a minute that the cats seem to like. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Garden Lady

customer_reviews.title: Does not work!
customer_reviews.text: The first time I tried it of course i got the reaction we all assume we'd get from out cats when using the product but the second time she looked at me and continued to scratch my chair as to say "ha... good try". I was really hoping I could stop saying "no, no, no dont do that Jinx" 15 times a day because shes still young but this product is a joke. It should be in the dollar store not on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: BrittanySkellington

customer_reviews.title: This product just scares the cat
customer_reviews.text: This product is very startling to the cats because the spray is very loud. I used it once and my cat is now terrified of me and runs away at first sight. He was already skiddish and this product destroyed any trust I had built up with him over the past 2 years. Now back to square one.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: I feel embarrassed that I wasted money on this product
customer_reviews.text: I feel embarrassed that I wasted money on this product. It's an aerosol can, nothing more. And a small one at that. One might as well use a squirtgun or yell.
customer_reviews.author: ragster

customer_reviews.title: Very forceful and loud, will never use again!!!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves to attack my Christmas tree as most cats do. I just wanted something that would have a little burst of air/water/smell to train her not to bother the tree. This thing scared my self, my fiance, and absolutely terrified my cat when I used it for the first time. The amount of sound and force seems appropriate for a 150lb animal, not a 10lb cat. Will never use again and incredibly disappointed. This seems more like punishment than a training tool.
customer_reviews.author: Hailey

customer_reviews.title: The orange can of discipline
customer_reviews.text: I love this little orange can of discipline. My cat likes to pretend-ish to scratch the door frame to wake me up so she can have breakfast. Depending on whether one of her nail caps came off she sometimes actually scratches the woodwork (and I would like my deposit back). This thing works amazing so that one toot from the can will keep her from scratching for about two months. Then she feels emboldened again. I'm happy it releases the pheromone with the spray. My cat forgives me for spraying it after about two minutes. Then she jumps up on the bed and meows at me for breakfast instead
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: 6 sprays and it is empty! Not a good value
customer_reviews.text: I would expect a product that costs this much to last longer than a couple of sprays. It seemed to work fine, and perhaps very well, but only after a couple times using it, it was empty - it only lasted 2 days. Not good value for the money. There is a chance that I just received a faulty can. The can got very cold every time I sprayed. How disappointing because it appeared it worked. Did not really notice a scent, but the cats sure did! It does make noise, but it did not appear to disturb the kittens that much - it was the smell that chased them away.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: These work! Was considering buying a static training collar for an aggressive cat and this popped up as a recommendation. I bought one to start and it worked! I took in a feral and am socializing him, but he kept chasing down my cowardly resident cat. One shot of this startled him mid run and he calmed down and laid down after. I have purchased two more so they are in hand in the rooms where he typically triggers. Now all I have to do pick up the can. He sees it and reconsiders his actions.
customer_reviews.author: DIY Queen

customer_reviews.title: effective tool
customer_reviews.text: My cat is immune to any kind of reprimand but this spray is very effective. I'm not sure the purpose of the floral smell unless it is just so we know the area the pheromones covered. Maybe the strong smell is also a deturant for the cat because it's very strong. But when he is acting up to get a rise out of me, he knows I mean business when I lift up the orange can and show him. He knows exactly what that means and usually knocks off the shennanigans.
customer_reviews.author: Osiris

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if I used it right because the bottle did not appear to function correctly and only caused itself to become so cold I could not hold it. But the spray that did come out to the desired area appeared to give no correction to my cats. I sprayed the bottle three times before it became so cold I could not hold it, when I went to try and do it again tonight and used it as instructed per the instructions to hold the bottle vertically, it again did the same thing except nothing came out. I would not waste your money on this product
customer_reviews.author: Dr. O

customer_reviews.title: One spritz was all it took to keep my cat away for good
customer_reviews.text: The scent is extremely powerful and lingering, so don't depress the lever for too long! One spritz of it near various areas I wanted to keep my cat away from--the door to a room he was forbidden entry to, the area around my printer--and he's never ventured near them again. And on occasion, when there's somewhere else that I want to keep him away from just temporarily, all I have to do is show him the little orange spray can and he slowly backs away, the poor thing!
customer_reviews.author: Jo G

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works!!
customer_reviews.text: I am IMPRESSED with how fast the shipping was!! I was not expecting my pkg until 23 October and it arrived today!! I've already tried it out on my kitten. He's a biter, scratcher and has discovered a love for scratching on my new chair. I used it on him almost as soon as I opened up the spray can. He was attacking my ankles and it worked!! I had to use it one more time and now he looks at me like, hmmmm, I'm not so sure about attacking Mom, lol
customer_reviews.author: Celeste

customer_reviews.title: Better used in a one cat household.
customer_reviews.text: This worked as far as getting my cat to immediately stop scratching the chair, but it scared all 3 cats (2 that were not misbehaving), so I’m not convinced this was the right way to correct undesirable behavior. All 3 cats were scared and confused. On the “up” side, I really liked the scent — I’m not sure it calmed the cats, but it calmed me! We reverted back to water in a spray bottle, which was more effective in training only the problem cat. If we had only one cat, I think this product would be more effective.
customer_reviews.author: stallm50

customer_reviews.title: Great training tool
customer_reviews.text: This works so well. My kittens are entering their naughty faze and I was despairing on how to keep them from breaking my stuff--or themselves-- and decided to give this a try. It worked! It makes a hissing noise and a nice scent comes out. The cats run from sound and scent and behave themselves again, a must buy for naughty kitties.
customer_reviews.author: grumpygirl1213

customer_reviews.title: Love this its fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I love using this product my cats absolutely hate the noise it makes it works to get my cats to stop fighting and to stay off of problem areas. They hate it I love it problem solved. I purchase these on subscription every month I get 3 new ones. My only complaint is you need to make a bigger size and a more automatic system with this product I have to find a can when one of my cats is acting up and its only 1oz that's not enough to last very long.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Davis

customer_reviews.title: The best investment for your sanity
customer_reviews.text: I have tried everything, many different sprays, products and methods over the years to stop our cat from destroying our bedroom in the middle of the night and instead she seems to thrive off the negative attention, and we are left sleep deprived.... until THIS THING. She is TERRIFIED of it!! Most of the time I don’t even need to spray it, I just reach for the orange can and she instantly runs away. The smell the first few times of use is horrible but it goes away after just a few times and it’s totally worth it. I used to be a sleep deprived Cat Mom and now i’m a well rested Cat Mom. THANKS SENTRY!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only three uses
customer_reviews.text: The sound that this product produce scared my cats away BUT I only used this product three times and it was GONE! Thats pretty unbelievable even for the price. I will NOT purchase this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Great for cats
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. I purchased it in hopes of keeping my cats from scratching the carpet. I don't think the pheromone spray makes a difference, since it's hard to get close enough to them to spray without them running away. The part that works is the noise. It makes an air horn-like noise when you spray it. It only took a couple of times using it before they stopped scratching. It's been several months and they still leave the carpet alone. I highly recommend this product if you have cats with mild behavior issues that need corrected.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Joy

customer_reviews.title: happy pet owner
customer_reviews.text: Having a cat that is sassy and constantly misbehaves is no picnic for any pet owner. Since buying this product my cat Rattles has had no misbehaved or scratched up the furniture. After a few week to a month of wearing the collar rattles behavior had greatly changed for bad cat to good cat. I would recommend sentry to any cat owner to buy one for there sassy cat.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Lasa

customer_reviews.title: Not greatly impressed
customer_reviews.text: We have used it 3 days. The cats have continued to jump on the counter. My greatest concern is that it’s causing a hearing loss for all of us. Sometimes they run when they I pick up the can, but real success would be a lack of desire to get up there. To those of you who say they like heights, yes I have a cat tree that they love and climb routinely. None of us like the smell. I’m spending extra time giving them attention for obedience which is 95% of the time. Perhaps we’ll give a few more days, but this painfully loud!
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Fadely

customer_reviews.title: Highly effective remote correction for cats!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE 8/30/2018: Amazon has tripled the price for this product. You will probably find it in your local pet store for much less. This is a fantastic product. We have a dependent cat that seeks attention by trying to destroy things. The first time we used "SENTRY Stop That!" He got the idea immediately. Although he still acts like a jerk and needs frequent reminding, just uncapping this halts him in his tracks and sends him for the hills. I recommend this as a fantastic means of remote correction for unruly cats.
customer_reviews.author: B.D. La Sage

customer_reviews.title: Helps keep cats off the kitchen counter!
customer_reviews.text: This is a miracle spray to stop your cats from engaging in bad behavior! I have 3 that love to jump on the kitchen counter uninvited and try to eat the food I am preparing. It is extremely annoying to say the least! My son discovered this spray on amazon and thought it looked like a good idea....he was right! When u spray it it makes a loud sound that scares the tar out of the cats! After a few sprays they got the idea and now if they are misbehaving we just show them the can and they go running!! They have cut down tremendously on counter jumping although they will still try when no one is around......
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: THIS PRODUCT ROCKS!
customer_reviews.text: This product ROCKS!!! My one year old cat has responded beautifully after only a couple of sprays! When he gets his wild streaks in the early morning and tears across my bed, all I have to do is reach for this can and he jumps off the bed and sits by the door!!! lol .. he might come up close to sniff it on occasion but he stops his bad behavior immediately when he sees the can in my hand. This is the Bomb! Only bad thing is I only have ONE can ... I wish I had two or three ... keep them in different rooms!
customer_reviews.author: DAFS

customer_reviews.title: very effective method to train your cat (yes that is possible)
customer_reviews.text: they say you cant train cats, but i have been able to train mine with this spray! my cat was waking us up at 4am every day begging for food, a couple days of spraying this and he never bothered us again. i feel bad because now, if we just show him the bottle he gets scared because he knows what he did was bad. be careful not to overuse for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Good training aid
customer_reviews.text: This is working well with adolescent as well as adult cat training. Using to stop furniture scratching, counter jumping and face dancing at 5:00 am. Youngest cat runs when the can is shown. Don’t even need to spray. Have bought 3, one for each room where needed. Seems to last quite a while. Wish the price was a bit lower.
customer_reviews.author: Janet W

customer_reviews.title: It’s kind of like kitty mace...
customer_reviews.text: Oh how my kitten dislikes this orange can of doom. The little monster wants to chew on cords? BLAHP! Kitty mace to the rescue. He gets a healthy dose of fear, I don’t have to replace another charging cable. Now don’t get me wrong, I’m not a bad cat parent— my little guy has a dynamic environment to play in and plenty of toys. He just prefers biting fingers, which is a problem. Stop That seems to do the trick for deterring him from bad behaviors while preserving my sanity and the power to my iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: Are you kidding me? The spray burst last 3 seconds and the van is empty! Not even enough to cover your chair. Like half a chair... need a refund. But can is completely empty. Crap.
customer_reviews.author: Angi K

customer_reviews.title: totally works
customer_reviews.text: my cat HATES this. I can just show her the can and she runs away. Using it to train her to stay off the table & counter. One can lasted a really long time. Noise is loud but not TOO loud for humans - sounds like a really loud hiss. I had to sharpie the word "CAT" onto the can because we have kids and the can just says "Behavior Correction Spray" - hahaha
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: An expensive squirt bottle.
customer_reviews.text: Essentially, this replaces a squirt bottle. I have a male cat that claws at the carpet just for fun (to sharpen his claws) so I bought this. I also have a female who is naughty sometimes. The stop that hasn't trained them to STOP doing the behaviors however, the second I pull the cap off they immediately stop what they're doing and scatter! So, it won't permanently stop the behavior (in my case) but it does work as a scare-away!
customer_reviews.author: sarah2134

customer_reviews.title: Cats truly don't like this
customer_reviews.text: So I foster for 2 local rescue organizations and this is the tail end of the of a very very busy kitten season. I bought this to help teach my foster kittens manners regarding climbing. It works like a charm- actually I just need to show the can now and even the kittens who weren't around when the can was spraying know what is means and stops the unwanted behavior. I will definitely buy this again next kitten season.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Did not work on my kitten!
customer_reviews.text: Had no effect at all on the kitten, not the smell, not the sound, she did not react at all. However, it smells awful, everyone in my house told me to throw it away so I did.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Not enough spray
customer_reviews.text: The noise is good at scaring the cat, and the scent is pleasant to me but not to kitty. I'm not sure if the calming pheromone thing is really true, as I don't think he was particularly calmed by it. Unfortunately, there just isn't enough spray inside it to justify the price. I didn't even use it very frequently, and it's already stopped functioning.
customer_reviews.author: Christina B.

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is the only thing that scares my cat
customer_reviews.text: I only use it when i HAVE to because she scrams when I use it. Actually she got to the point where all I have to do is lift the can up and show it to her and she runs away. That saves me from having to use it and saves me money. LOL. Try it.
customer_reviews.author: Sabio

customer_reviews.title: Get this and the ssscat together
customer_reviews.text: (for my cats who keep getting my Christmas tree) Get this AND the SSSCAT spray thing so you can spray them when you catch them and then put the SSSCAT on guard when you're not there to get them. So far 1 week in and no more Christmas decorations in the floor despite two 1 year old kittens who were previously removing everything from the tree, trying to eat some ornaments, and bending down all branches.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Cat doesn't care much
customer_reviews.text: He gets a little scared but comes back for me within minutes. We were trying to train him to stay away from a specific door. We still use it, and the noise frightens him like he backs away. But the scent doesn't linger causing him to steer clear for long.
customer_reviews.author: TashaD

customer_reviews.title: she'll run like a bat out of hell and won't even think ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the only thing that will stop my terrorist cat. When she hears the lid come off, she knows what's coming and stops whatever she's doing immediately. If I'm quick enough to get the spray off, she'll run like a bat out of hell and won't even think about doing that same thing again while I'm around for several weeks. Just be sure to spray your cat while it's in the act... otherwise you'll just make your cat scared and confused, as opposed to trained.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce McMurrey

customer_reviews.title: Complete Waste-Air In A Can!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely does not work, please don’t waste your money on this product. I bought this based off of all the good reviews but apparently those cat owners had cats that were easy to train I used a whole can within three days just trying to get my cat to stay out of the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t phase our crazy kitty
customer_reviews.text: Dang it, I was super excited to try this product to keep this crazy cat of ours off of the tables and counters in our house. Unfortunately I can’t say if our cat is just too strong willed, or if the product is a gimmick. It’s pretty expensive spr such a small can. I do hope it works for someone else as the idea behind it seems cool.
customer_reviews.author: Mica Deapen

customer_reviews.title: ... hopes for this product since it had some very good reviews. But the first spray left both my ...
customer_reviews.text: Had high hopes for this product since it had some very good reviews. But the first spray left both my husband and myself feeling sick for an hour afterwards even though we followed the instructions as directed. I felt so bad as to what it may have done to my poor cat!
customer_reviews.author: L.. Gehret

customer_reviews.title: Best product and seller ever.
customer_reviews.text: First of all, this seller is amazing. They emailed me to check in and make sure I was happy with the product and offered to answer any questions or concerns I might have about the product. WHAT?! I guess customer service isn’t dead! Also, this product is awesome. My cat loves to hide underneath furniture and “hunt my feet” while I’m walking around but I end up tripping over him! Poor baby. I was walking around on egg shells so worried he’d pounce and get hurt. This spray corrected the behavior in 2 days. No more walking on egg shells!
customer_reviews.author: Francesca

customer_reviews.title: Gets job done.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with product. Smells nice, has an acceptable noise level to grab the cats attention, does the job it’s intended to do keeping bad cat behavior at bay. By the 3 rd warning my cats know I mean business. Pip sees can and goes opposite direction. Toby isn’t afraid of it but does respect it.
customer_reviews.author: Dutchie

customer_reviews.title: I like the smell
customer_reviews.text: My cat hates the sound of this so much that all I have to do is show her the can and she shuts TF up. I like the smell, my husband doesn't. Well, he can deal with her screaming in the middle of the night then, I'll put my headphones on. Minus a star because it only felt half full when it arrived, and it's not a big can to boot.
customer_reviews.author: Random Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, good price
customer_reviews.text: I've used this spray previously and really like it when my cats get into something they shouldn't. Like the Christmas tree.....it works, but you have to be there while your cat is misbehaving. If they are scratching your couch and you walk up they run away and it spray it behind them it won't keep them from scratching your couch again, you need to catch them in the act to correct the behavior.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: I should have tried this first!
customer_reviews.text: My cat scratches at the carpet by my bedroom door and I have tried the motion detector sprays, sticky tape and natural scent deterrents -- none of them worked. I used this spray twice, both times I was in my bedroom when my cat was scratching. When I heard him, I quickly opened the door and sprayed in his direction (don't spray directly in their faces). He has not scratched or meowed at my door since. It's a miracle - my carpet and my sleeping schedule are saved!
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff. One short spray and my cats run for cover. No - they aren’t traumatized and yes they still love me. But if I hold up the “bad cat spray” they now know that mom means business. I used one can for months (ummmm - don’t overspray). Now only need a refill because the stubborn boy cat thinks under mom’s bed is an awesome place to hide. I don’t know about pheromones but the noise is enough to deter even my human family. Worth the money for the stubborn feline family members.
customer_reviews.author: Shonna Hearn

customer_reviews.title: Great for Training
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help with training my new young kitty. Now all I have to do is show him the can, and he runs. It has helped to keep him out of the kitchen, any other place or furniture. It did not take long for him to understand, what was OK, and what is not.
customer_reviews.author: T Cleveland

customer_reviews.title: Smaller size equals smaller price
customer_reviews.text: If you genuinely use this to stop your animals from doing something, you will run out of it somewhat quick. You get the ad on price or the lower price for this product due to it being a smaller size than most pet stores. Great if you only need it for moderate use though. My cat now here’s the sound of me shaking it and he will run away and stop scratching the furniture. Works for me!
customer_reviews.author: Petlady

customer_reviews.title: Good for cats
customer_reviews.text: This is basically a glorified air horn for cats. It spits out a scent that supposed to calm cats but it's really the noise that makes for a great deterrent. I've purchased this a few times, it does a good job of keeping my sometimes-aggressive cat in line. Now, all I have to do is pop the top off and he runs away... Eventually coming back much calmer and ready to cuddle. Love this product.
customer_reviews.author: adrichmond

customer_reviews.title: she's pretty much stopped scratching completely
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I think I have only actually had to spray this once or twice to stop my kitty from scratching on our carpet. Since then, she stops immediately if she even sees the bottle. Since having it, she's pretty much stopped scratching completely.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Moayedi

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: Sadly this product did not work for me. When you press the button, a perfumy scent is released and it makes a loud noise. My kitten bites very hard and I was hoping this product would train her stop doing that. She actually doesn't seem bothered by the smell or sound at all.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Can isn’t very big but the effects are amazing. I barely even had to use it before my cat stopped the behavior. I still have more than half a bottle left and it’s been almost 3 months. It has no scent and it is a bit loud when spraying. For the most part, I can just show my cat the can or pop the lid off and he’ll run away quickly. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Terra

customer_reviews.title: Satan in a Spray Can
customer_reviews.text: If you asked my cat he would say it's satan in a spray can. Was helpful in discouraging him from clawing the couch.
customer_reviews.author: cbtlr

customer_reviews.title: Stank up the apartment
customer_reviews.text: This product did scare my cat a little and get him to temporarily stop his behavior. It didn't last for long, though, and in the meantime my entire apartment smelled VERY bad.
customer_reviews.author: KLC

customer_reviews.title: This works.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product, but they are stingy with the amount. Too expensive for what you get. I don't understand why it has to have a scent to it. It's the hissing sound that gets the cat's attention.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Not for me....
customer_reviews.text: Scared my kittens so much they didn't come out from under the couch for a few hours. It made me feel bad. Plus, when you have three kittens and one is doing something wrong and the other two are not and you press the button. How do my babies know who is doing what wrong. Good for one cat but more than one and I think it confuses them.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Would not waste money on this product.
customer_reviews.text: Once you try to use it, the cat hears this foghorn sound and takes off, and won't come near it. I sprayed it on my hands and then pet the cat, but didn't see much change. Had no smell either.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Won’t work for all cats
customer_reviews.text: Used the whole can and my cat is as bad as ever. Gave it two stars because he did learn to run when he saw me coming with the can, but it didn’t stop him from misbehaving in the first place. Was worth a try, I’m sure it would work for some cats that aren’t as bold and rowdy as mine.
customer_reviews.author: MsSunshine1017

customer_reviews.title: My cat went insane and this brought him back
customer_reviews.text: A year ago, something randomly set off our car (still not sure what it was), but he started hissing and attacking our feet. Anytime we would move, our feet would he mauled. His tail would get really big and he would start sounding like a siren. One spray of this stuff, and he's back to normal. We keep this around everywhere in the house just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Tenchi

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Adopted a 7 month old kitten who thinks everything is a game and or prey. Constantly jumping up the walls..attacking anything that moves..needed something to calm her down. While shes not 100% chill it has helped. Anytime she does something bad i grab the can..just seeing it she stops and i barely have to even spray it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: christa

customer_reviews.title: Very effective on our two well behaved cats, not so much on our troublemaker
customer_reviews.text: Overall I would recommend this spray. We've found it pretty effective without it upsetting our cats. The only issue is that our more bullheaded cat doesn't always respond to it. It'll make him stop doing whatever he's doing in the moment, but it doesn't always stop him from doing it again. It has definitely has made an impact on keeping our other two from getting too close to the toaster is on, and stuff like that.
customer_reviews.author: anna reep

customer_reviews.title: I have a very well trained dog except he barks ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a very well trained dog except he barks (or I should say barked) at everything. I’ve used the spray twice when he barked & haven’t had to use it again. He got the message loud & clear. I had used it before with one of my cats but never thought to use it with my dog. All I can say is that it has been very effective with both my cat & dog. I finally have peace & quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Kingston

customer_reviews.title: A must buy for getting your cats attention and eliminating bad behavior!
customer_reviews.text: Great customer service and response from company. Using this for counter climbers and they are scared when I even show them the cab lol. The hiss sound that comes out is a definite deterrent for bad behavior. Will always continue to use this. Make sure you buy two so you have one on hand or a second one for another room in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Discipline Tool!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great discipline tool for our cats. We purchased this to prevent redirected aggression and fighting between our cats after our neighbor's outdoor cat constantly pops in to start up a riled up window fight. After several uses, our cats have learned to not engage in window fighting with our neighbor's cat and stopped fighting with each other because of those window fights. Amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Briston Brown

customer_reviews.title: No Luck With Howling/Excessive Meowing
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had as much success as others. My cat (neutered since he was 6 months) howls incessantly... he doesn't want/need food, water, or affection when he does this (as I give him all these things and he still continues). Whenever I use this spray, he just squints his eyes for a second and then carries on with the bad behavior. Worth a shot for the price, I guess, but no luck here.
customer_reviews.author: JaxxiePoo

customer_reviews.title: Convenient behavior correction solution but expensive
customer_reviews.text: It's a very convenient effective behavior solution (aside from motion activated ones) but too expensive for the 1 oz. With any unwanted behavior deference, it takes repetition or conditioning, which means a lot of $$. Will need to look for other options.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: I originally thought it was a spray, but i found out it was something even better. Worked really well. Cats hate the sound and I'm sure the smell also bothers them. I'm not sure if it works for all cats, but it worked in our house. All I have to do is hold it up now and the cats run away.
customer_reviews.author: c

customer_reviews.title: 10 sprays and it was empty
customer_reviews.text: 10 sprays is not nearly enough to train a cat. Certainly not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Razalas72

customer_reviews.title: Nasty smell. super loud.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Smelled soooo strong and bad. Was gagging. And suuuuper loud! and for safety reasons you cannot return it
customer_reviews.author: sara

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for my barn kittens- just scared them
customer_reviews.text: I tried this for my barn kittens to get them to stop hissing and swatting at us. It didn't work; they were hissing and swatting because they were scared and it just scared them more.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: This works!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works!! When I adopted 2 kitties from a shelter (King Street Cats), they were 15 months old and were born in the shelter. They didn’t know a sofa or any upholstered furniture. So, I bought this and it kept them from scratching furniture! I bought a couple more for other rooms... a few years later I had to move in with elderly parents and while hopping up on the dining table was OK at my house, it was not permitted at my parents... and it still works!! I only had to use it once or twice with 4 year old kitties.
customer_reviews.author: Kcjones

customer_reviews.title: Cat is Scared of the Can
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, just buy compressed air. The pheromone addition doesn't seem to add much and the can is smaller than a regular old can of compressed air. It's mostly the noise that deters her, but it definitely does work
customer_reviews.author: CollegeDormLife

customer_reviews.title: Good for scaring the crap out your cat
customer_reviews.text: In my experience it doesn’t really stop bad behaviors so much as it just scares the crap out of cat, propelling it in that cartoon-like running in place action. Which in the heat of the moment I’m okay with when I’m ticked off with what cat is doing. Not effective for long term solution.
customer_reviews.author: Blastoff

customer_reviews.title: I can’t believe my Christmas tree has survived!!!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves to run around. Last years tree was done the FRIST day we put it up but after investigating how to control him and make him stop scratching and biting and bought serval thing this has been the only thing that has worked.
customer_reviews.author: allie

customer_reviews.title: Effective but has an odd smell
customer_reviews.text: While this doesn't work at stopping our cat from trying the behavior again as the product states, all we need to do is leave it out and she will avoid whatever it was she was going to do (which is usually bolting outside.) I guess it works just as well as a squirt gun.
customer_reviews.author: ESB

customer_reviews.title: Worked great :)
customer_reviews.text: This product works great and has a pleasant smell. However it does not have much liquid in it and goes quickly. I did not use mine very often and it still emptied rather quickly after just a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Repeat Buyer!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this for a few years now, it works to stop them from doing something but it doesn't change them from doing it. The cats still pick on the smaller cat or scratch the furniture, so this isn't a remedy for getting rid of a behavior. But when I am home to catch them it certainly does stop them, most times now I don't even have to spray it I just pick up the can and they sit down or run.
customer_reviews.author: DeAnna

product_meta.title: SENTRY Stop That! For Cats, 1 oz
product_meta.description: Noise and Pheromone Spray combined provide immediate response that stops bad behavior in its tracks. Great for use with behavior issues such as barking, aggression, pulling on leash, meowing. The noise gets the pet's attention and the specific pheromone stops unwanted behavior immediately and redirects the pet's attention.
feature_bullets: Uses noise and pheromone technology to stop bad behaviors in cats
Clinically proven to provide quick, effective results without causing harm to cats

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
